title: 2019 Bentley Continental GT Convertible review: opulent, ostentatious and so thirsty
text:
My daughter sniffed: “I can’t believe that people actually use Bentleys as real cars.” Yet before the 2003 launch of the VW Phaeton-based Continental GT, a 2.4-tonne, two-door coupé powered by a 6.0-litre W12 engine, people simply didn’t use Bentleys every day. “We'll take the Bentley,” was a term of old monied class and not at all nouveau.

But the Continental GT pushed Bentley production to 10,000 a year, in the process vindicating VW’s decision (Ferdinand Piëch’s actually) to invest in the old winged badge.

For better or worse, it cheapened the marque. Suddenly you saw Bentleys outside Waitrose, Nandos and nail bars. And in 16 years the company has sold 66,000 Continental GTs. There have been...
